eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule

Class LabelPositioningUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule.LabelPositioningUtils

  • public class LabelPositioningUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has a couple of methods which are used when labels are being positioned automatically. Developers of their own geometric objects are encouraged to use these utilities in their getLabelCoordinates methods.
    Author:
    Augustin Zidek

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LabelPositioningUtils()

    • Constructor Detail

      • LabelPositioningUtils

        public LabelPositioningUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • getAutoPlacementToCircle

        public static MCoordinate getAutoPlacementToCircle(double angleDeg,
                                                   java.awt.Font font,
                                                   java.lang.String text,
                                                   double baseDistance)
        Determines relative coordinates of a label placed within certain distance from the base and at the given angle.
        Parameters:
        angleDeg - The angle in degrees relative to the x-axis in the positive direction with the origin in the label base coordinates
        font - The font of the label
        text - The text of the label. If the text is null empty string ("") will be used instead.
        baseDistance - The distance at which the label should be from the base coordinate. This method will make sure that the label is NEVER within this circle and always has some extra small space (so it is not touching the bounding circle).
        Returns:
        The 2D coordinate of the left bottom corner of the label

      • getAutoPlacementToRectangle

        public static MCoordinate getAutoPlacementToRectangle(double angleDeg,
                                                      MBoundingBox rectangle,
                                                      java.awt.Font font,
                                                      java.lang.String text)
        Determines relative coordinates of a label placed on a circumference of a (bounding) rectangle at the given angle.
        Parameters:
        angleDeg - The angle in degrees relative to the x-axis in the positive direction with the origin in the label base coordinates
        font - The font of the label
        text - The text of the label. If the text is null empty string ("") will be used instead.
        rectangle - The rectangle to which the label should be aligned
        Returns:
        The 2D coordinate of the left bottom corner of the label

      • getLabelDimensions

        public static MCoordinate getLabelDimensions(java.lang.String text,
                                             java.awt.Font font)
        Calculates the dimensions of the given text using the give font.
        Parameters:
        text - The text of the label. If null, then empty string will be used.
        font - The font of the label. If null, then the default font will be used.
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the label (width, height) stored within the MCoordinate

      • alignAccordingToAngle

        public static MCoordinate alignAccordingToAngle(MBoundingBox boundingRect,
                                                double angleDeg)
        This method takes the given bounding rectangle and shifts it according to the given angle so that:
        If the angle is 0-90 the lower left corner of the rectangle is on the original position. I.e. no shifting happens in this case.
        If the angle is 90-180 the lower right corner of the rectangle is on the original position.
        If the angle is 180-270 the upper right corner of the rectangle is on the original position.
        If the angle is 270-360 the upper left corner of the rectangle is on the original position.
        Parameters:
        boundingRect - The bounding rectangle of the object, most likely the label
        angleDeg - The angle at which the bounding rectangle should be positioned
        Returns:
        The coordinate where the lower left corner of the bounding box should be placed. Note that the angle is used only to decide what shifting shall be done, not for any positioning. For that use the getAutoPlacement method.
